name: Medicines A to Z
description: Find out how your medicine works, how and when to take it, possible side effects and answers to your common questions.

significantLink.name: Eplerenone
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on eplerenone – how it works, side effects, dosage and who can take it.

significantLink.name: Erythromycin
significantLink.description:
Brand names: Erythrocin, Erythroped, Erymax,  Erythroped A, Tiloryth. 
Find out how erythromycin treats chest and skin infections, ear infections and sexually transmitted infections (STIs), and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Escitalopram
significantLink.description: Brand name: Cipralex. Find out how escitalopram treats depression, anxiety, obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) and panic attacks, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Esomeprazole
significantLink.description: Brand names: Nexium, Nexium Control, Emozul, Guardium Acid Reflux Control and Ventra. Find out how esomeprazole treats indigestion and heartburn and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Ezetimibe
significantLink.description: Find out how ezetimibe treats high blood cholesterol and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Felodipine
significantLink.description: Brand names: Plendil, Cardioplen, Folpik, Felotens, Vascalpha, Neofel, Parmid. Find out how felodipine treats high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fentanyl
significantLink.description: Find out how fentanyl treats severe pain and how to take or use it.

significantLink.name: Ferrous fumarate
significantLink.description: Find out how ferrous fumarate treats and prevents iron deficiency anaemia, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Ferrous sulfate
significantLink.description: Find out how ferrous sulfate treats and prevents iron deficiency anaemia, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fexofenadine
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on fexofenadine – what it's used for, side effects, dosage and who can take it

significantLink.name: Finasteride
significantLink.description: Find out how finasteride treats benign prostate enlargement and hair loss in men, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Flucloxacillin
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on flucloxacillin – what it's used for, side effects, dosage and who can take it.

significantLink.name: Fluconazole
significantLink.description: Find out how fluconazole treats thrush and other fungal infections, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fluoxetine (Prozac)
significantLink.description: Brand name: Prozac. Find out how fluoxetine treats mental health conditions including depression, obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) and bulimia, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fluticasone inhalers
significantLink.description: Find out how inhaled fluticasone treats asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fluticasone nasal spray and drops
significantLink.description: Find out how fluticasone nasal spray treats allergic rhinitis symptoms and how drops treat nasal polyps, and how to use them.

significantLink.name: Fluticasone skin creams
significantLink.description: Find out how fluticasone skin creams treat itching, swollen and irritated skin, and how to use them.

significantLink.name: Folic acid
significantLink.description: Brand names: Preconceive, Lexpec. Find out how folic acid helps keep your baby healthy in pregnancy and treats or prevents folate deficiency anaemia and side effects of methotrexate, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Furosemide
significantLink.description: Brand names: Frusol, Diuresal. Find out how furosemide treats high blood pressure, heart failure and oedema, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fusidic acid
significantLink.description: Brand names: Fucithalmic, Fucidin. Find out how fusidic acid treats skin and eye infections and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Fybogel (ispaghula husk)
significantLink.description: Other brand names: Ispagel. Find out how Fybogel treats constipation and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Gabapentin
significantLink.description: Read about how gabapentin treats epilepsy and nerve pain and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Gaviscon (alginic acid)
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on Gaviscon – what it's used for, side effects, dosage and who can take it.

significantLink.name: Gliclazide
significantLink.description: Brand names: Dacadis, Diamicron, Edicil, Glydex, Laaglyda, Lamzarin, Nazdol, Vamju, Ziclaseg and Zicron. Find out how gliclazide treats type 2 diabetes and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Glimepiride
significantLink.description: Find out how glimepiride treats type 2 diabetes and how to take it.
